head.title: Abortion Bill Won't Encourage Teen-Agers to Reach Out to Parents

hedline.hl1: Abortion Bill Won't Encourage Teen-Agers to Reach Out to Parents

abstract.p: Diane Okrent letter says Amy S Grossberg and Brian C Peterson were equally culpable in the conception and destruction of their child, and their sentences should have been equal (July 10 article)

block.p: Re ''Teen-Agers Get Terms in Prison in Baby's Death'' (front page, July 10): When I was a teen-ager in the 1960's, my mother warned me about the dangers of unprotected sex, saying that ''the woman always gets left holding the bag.'' Fortunately, she taught me and my brothers about protection, and promised us support if we had problems.

Re ''Teen-Agers Get Terms in Prison in Baby's Death'' (front page, July 10): When I was a teen-ager in the 1960's, my mother warned me about the dangers of unprotected sex, saying that ''the woman always gets left holding the bag.'' Fortunately, she taught me and my brothers about protection, and promised us support if we had problems.

The unequal prison and probation terms given to Amy S. Grossberg and Brian C. Peterson prove my mother's point. I am in no way condoning what they did, but Ms. Grossberg and Mr. Peterson were equally culpable in the conception and destruction of their child. They should be punished equally.
